              throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Moves a robot along the board
        Parameters:
        robotToMove - the robot that is to be moved on the board
        TeamNumber - the team number of the team that the robot is on
        range - the range that the destination is from the robot
        direction - the direction that the robot wishes to go
        movesLeft - the amount of moves that the robot can travel
        Returns:
        the number of moves left
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - an error that is caught during runtime

        yOffset - -1, 0, 1
        Returns:

      • getClosest

        public java.util.List<Robot> getClosest(Robot r)
        Finds a returns a list of the closest robots to input robot r Will return up to 4 robots, in a range up to 3 spaces Called by the ForthInterpreter
        Parameters:
        r - the robot asking for closest robots
        Returns:
        List a list containing the closest robots

      • sendMail

        public boolean sendMail(Robot sender,
                        int receiverNumber,
                        ForthWord value)
        Sends a forth word from one robot to the mailbox of another Robots must be on the same team, and the forth word must be either an int, a string, or a boolean Called by the forth interpreter
        Parameters:
        sender - the robot sending the message
        receiverNumber - the member number of the robot to recieve the message (on the same team)
        value - the value to send
        Returns:
        a bool indicating whether the operation was a success. Will fail if the receiverNumber is invalid, if the receiver is destroyed, or if the receiver's mailbox is full

      • displayMessage

        public void displayMessage(java.lang.String newActionMessage,
                           ConsoleMessageType type)
        Will be called by the forth interpreter to show new actions for display in the interface Will be called anytime the robot does anything, so the user can be updated as to what is happening
        Parameters:
        newActionMessage - the latest action being run by a robot
        type - the type of message to display
